articles.headline: Amway Made China a Billion-Dollar Market. Now It Faces a Crackdown.
articles.snippet: Chinese regulators are questioning the tactics of companies that rely on sales representatives who recruit others below them. Sales by so-called multilevel marketing firms have surged.
articles.abstract: Chinese regulators are questioning the tactics of companies that rely on sales representatives who recruit others below them. Sales by so-called multilevel marketing firms have surged.
articles.lead_paragraph: LANZHOU, China — Feng Gang stood in front of 150 people in a conference hall in Beijing that Amway, the American marketing giant, calls its flagship “experience center.”
articles.byline: By Ryan Mcmorrow and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Tax Law May Send Factories and Jobs Abroad, Critics Say
articles.snippet: Supporters say the recently approved tax law will help American multinationals compete more aggressively overseas. Others see incentives to put factories overseas.
articles.abstract: Supporters say the recently approved tax law will help American multinationals compete more aggressively overseas. Others see incentives to put factories overseas.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Indiana, Missouri and Pennsylvania, President Trump used the same promise to sell the tax bill: It would bring jobs streaming back to struggling cities and towns.

articles.headline: Fusion GPS Founder Hauled From the Shadows for the Russia Election Investigation
articles.snippet: Glenn R. Simpson’s firm quietly compiled the notorious dossier of possible links between President Trump and Russia. Then it became public.
articles.abstract: Glenn R. Simpson’s firm quietly compiled the notorious dossier of possible links between President Trump and Russia. Then it became public.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From the start, he was a central casting misfire — the dark artist slicing through the capital by electric scooter, a cloak-and-dagger digger better known to former colleagues for scratching his bare belly in plain office view.

articles.headline: Tech Backlash Grows as Investors Press Apple to Act on Children’s Use
articles.snippet: Apple should give parents more tools to curb technology use by children and study the health effects of excessive screen time, two big funds said.
articles.abstract: Apple should give parents more tools to curb technology use by children and study the health effects of excessive screen time, two big funds said.
articles.lead_paragraph: A creator of the iPhone called the device “addictive.”

articles.headline: Oprah 2020? Democrats Swing From Giddy to Skeptical at the Prospect
articles.snippet: In the imagination of some Democrats, Oprah Winfrey seemed an answer to the party’s problems. Others questioned whether the country would be willing to accept another TV star.
articles.abstract: In the imagination of some Democrats, Oprah Winfrey seemed an answer to the party’s problems. Others questioned whether the country would be willing to accept another TV star.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With a booming speech at the Golden Globe Awards on Sunday night, Oprah Winfrey, the billionaire media entrepreneur and former television talk-show host, launched a thousand fantasies for Democrats: Of a historic campaign to put a black woman in the White House. Of a celebrity candidate, known for her big-hearted optimism, taking on a reality-show president defined by his thirst for combat. Of a presidency, some joked, where everybody would get a car.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Amy Chozick

articles.headline: As Economy Strengthens, Fed Ponders New Approach
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve is welcoming a debate among economists about proposed changes that might improve its response to future economic downturns.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve is welcoming a debate among economists about proposed changes that might improve its response to future economic downturns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the wake of a deep economic crisis and a disappointingly slow recovery, a growing number of experts, including some Federal Reserve officials, say it is time for the Fed to consider a new approach to managing the economy.

articles.headline: What a $4,000 Treadmill Means for the Future of Gadgets
articles.snippet: Peloton, which sells an internet-connected spin bicycle, unveiled a $4,000 internet-connected treadmill. The company’s insight: The gadget is not as important as the service.
articles.abstract: Peloton, which sells an internet-connected spin bicycle, unveiled a $4,000 internet-connected treadmill. The company’s insight: The gadget is not as important as the service.
articles.lead_paragraph: The home fitness start-up Peloton might sound faddish, like another in the parade of bougie tech-lifestyle brands selling dubious-sounding “disruption!” at millionaire prices. Its first product — an internet-connected, brushed-steel spin bicycle equipped with a 22-inch touch-screen — sells for $2,000, and you still have to pay $39 a month to get any content to fill the screen.

articles.headline: North Korea Moves Toward Détente With Seoul
articles.snippet: The announcement that North Korea would participate in the Games was welcomed in the South, but few believed that Mr. Kim was motivated by the Olympic spirit.
articles.abstract: The announcement that North Korea would participate in the Games was welcomed in the South, but few believed that Mr. Kim was motivated by the Olympic spirit.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, spent 2017 rattling the world with nuclear and long-range missile tests and has promised more provocations in 2018. So it was a surprise when he deftly seized on the Winter Olympics on Tuesday to turn toward diplomacy with Seoul, playing the part of the statesman even while seeking fractures in the seven-decade alliance between South Korea and the United States.
articles.byline: By Choe Sang-Hun and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Mudslides Strike Southern California, Leaving at Least 13 Dead
articles.snippet: Drenching rain sent mud roaring down the hillsides of Santa Barbara County, sweeping away houses in wildfire-ravaged areas.
articles.abstract: Drenching rain sent mud roaring down the hillsides of Santa Barbara County, sweeping away houses in wildfire-ravaged areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: Read the latest on the California mudslides with Wednesday’s updates.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Medina, Thomas Fuller and Tim Arango
